tidyheatmap 0.0.0.9000
  • Get started
  • Reference

tidyheatmap

The goal of tidyheatmap is to provide a tidyverse-style interface to the powerful heatmap package pheatmap by @raivokolde. This enables the convenient generation of complex heatmaps from tidy data.

Installation

You can install tidyheatmap from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")

devtools::install_github("jbengler/tidyheatmap")

Example

Given a tidy data frame of gene expression data like data_exprs, you can easily generate a customized heatmap.

library(tidyheatmap)

tidy_heatmap(data_exprs,
             rows = external_gene_name,
             columns = sample,
             values = expression,
             annotation_col = c(sample_type, condition, group),
             scale = "row",
             color_scale_n = 16,
             color_scale_min = -2,
             color_scale_max = 2,
             gaps_row = direction,
             gaps_col = group
)
#> $m
